messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI HiFORCE Plugin?
The ComfyUI HiFORCE Plugin is a custom nodes pack provided by HiFORCE for ComfyUI that helps to conveniently enhance images through Sampler, Upscaler, Mask, and more.
What is a prerequisite for using the ComfyUI HiFORCE Plugin?
To use the ComfyUI HiFORCE Plugin, you should install ComfyUI-Impact-Pack as many optimizations are built upon the foundation of ComfyUI-Impact-Pack.
How do you install the ComfyUI HiFORCE Plugin?

To install the ComfyUI HiFORCE Plugin, you need to: 1. cd custom_nodes, 2. git clone https://github.com/hiforce/comfyui-hiforce-plugin.git, 3. cd comfyui-hiforce-plugin and run pip install -r requirements.txt.
What is the Basic Sampler node in the ComfyUI HiFORCE Plugin?

The Basic Sampler node in the ComfyUI HiFORCE Plugin is very similar to the KSampler provided by ComfyUI, except that it exposes the 'full_drawing' option which corresponds to the 'return_with_leftover_noise' option in KSampler (Advanced), but with opposite values.
What does the Loopback Sampler node in the ComfyUI HiFORCE Plugin allow you to do?
The Loopback Sampler node in the ComfyUI HiFORCE Plugin allows you to generate images progressively using different drawing intensities.
What is the enhancement made in the HfTwoSamplersForMask node compared to the TwoSamplersforMask in ComfyUI-Impact-Pack?
In the HfTwoSamplersForMask node, an 'enable' option is added. If the 'enable' option is set to false, then this sampler will not function.
What is the HfIterativeLatentUpscale node in the ComfyUI HiFORCE Plugin?
The HfIterativeLatentUpscale node is an enhancement of the IterativeLatentUpscale node in ComfyUI-Impact-Pack. It adds an 'enable' option, and if it is set to false, the sampler will not function.
